name: v0.6.2
body:
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/da7fe39a6bae44673bea0372a9565ded2ae8af60 upgrade to pod5 0.0.41.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/c45905c6fbc7bf800bbc85e0514c2410fe7229e4 add milliseconds to start_time + convert to UTC.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/199a3f037efcb501178fd4eb3a6b0532724aa593 Adds duration as `du` tag to BAM output.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/717f414f583882b46845385da95e8a95c35f5ed1 fix bug in fast5 read id subset pre-processing.

name: v0.6.1
body:
# Bugfixes

 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/ebfc6498f061aae5a3261d1df23fa3ae669e5a6e set TLEN in SAM.
 -  https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/02962268262b9bba0447ddc3f764ddf78edd4db4 fixed `--save-ctc` writing.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/c4da6793ebefc943654c1a784e5626e11e3f8105 https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/5fadc781ebbede7369e66fbbf37c5d83c5226e12 more robust signal trimming.

name: v0.6.0
body:
## Highlights

 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/f2a3a8efb394cad07e99c20a9e48186c768c4ba9 improved quantile based signal scaling algorithm.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/552a5ce2306ecf50b42dcaf8efcd4d126c7af90a significant improvement in short read calling vs previous bonito versions.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/5ceb6e1a543d79bb2d20f98b12d4589709f58182 qscore filtering.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/cfb7e06dc91ae09fb21229863721fa603f05da8f new R10.4.1 E8.2 models *(v3.5.2)* for both 260bps and 400bps conditions. 
   - `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_260bps_fast@v3.5.2`
   - `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_260bps_hac@v3.5.2`
   - `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_260bps_sup@v3.5.2`
   - `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_fast@v3.5.2`
   - `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_hac@v3.5.2`
   - `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_400bps_sup@v3.5.2`

## Bugfixes
 
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/fa56de1bd7df55a2e149e21d708132256d8fc12e skip over any fast5 files that cause runtime errors.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/f0827d931df550eded9d87744df62ba718db9af6 use stderr for all model download output to avoid issues with sequence output formats.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/3c8294bef06d0cf6a163ff6ac8e0ddaef1be0b53 upgraded koi with py3.7 support.  

## Misc

 - Python 3.10 supported added.
 - [Read tags](https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/blob/master/documentation/SAM.md#read-tags) added for signal scaling midpoint, dispersion and version.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/9f7614df20eb12f93b0e107ed94cda8977c80096 support for exporting models to dorado.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/90b6d191db416079e08ce53f4d812d9137ed6afd add estimated total time to basecaller progress
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/8ba78eddf4dbcf3d462bc6bf58f36c5f2e508297 export for guppy binary weights 

### Installation

```
$ pip install ont-bonito
```

By default pip will install torch which is build against CUDA 10.2. For CUDA 11.3 builds run:

```
$ pip install --extra-index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu113 ont-bonito
```

_Note: packaging has been reworked and the `ont-bonito-cuda111` and `ont-bonito-cuda113` packages are now retired. The CUDA version of torch is handled exclusively with the use of `pip install --extra-index-url` now._

name: v0.5.3
body:
## Highlights
 
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/c0f83f3477ec0bdbf3a37135d7f1508119d655d9 POD5 support - https://github.com/nanoporetech/pod5-file-format
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/27f8468de87e5f3a38fc9a8126dcf978eac90f3d Kit 14 models `dna_r10.4.1_e8.2_{fast, hac, sup}@v3.5.1` added.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/e6282a29cacd0428932915b41988c0f494e94b56 Upgrade to remora 1.1 _(kit 14 mod bases)_.

## Bugfixes 
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/4585b74c433abbc6c9af447c8fdeac85161ca64d fix for handling _stitching_ of short reads _(read < chunksize)_.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/9a4f98a9d4e6f6f2fc03ebff1fe02cea01ae71cf fix for overly confidant qscores in repeat regions.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/318719871981430c803b97d8d2120c5bf92f9dbc scaling protection for short reads.

## Misc 

 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/d57a658dc6140ed57375434547b188a658e76055 training validation times improved.
 
### Installation

The default version on PyTorch in PyPI supports Volta and below _(SM70)_ and can be installed like so - 

```
$ pip install ont-bonito
```

For newer GPUs _(Turing, Ampere)_ please use -

```
$ pip install -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html ont-bonito-cuda113
```

name: v0.5.1
body:
## Highlights

 - There is no longer a requirement for a CUDA toolkit on the target system, which significantly improves the ease of installation<sup>1</sup>. 
 - BAM spec [0.0.2](https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/blob/master/documentation/SAM.md) _(+move table, numbers of samples, trimming information)._ 

### Features

 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/241e622a8f9ec64ad50f5634e9d3a4db95ffa104 record the move table into the SAM/BAM.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/a6a3ed2e9294a68654684c117217fbd8e4b5d4bb `ont-koi` replaces `seqdist` + `cupy`<sup>1</sup>. 

### Bugfixes

 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/c8417b7d0a7dbaa338983413ba5c6fbcd4163075 handle datatimes with subsecond resolution.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/6f2346738cb65b3003f469c164977cf226ee04dd fix the mappy preset.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/737d9a2e8ac67ca257f47729d8e78ae5c8086dc1 better management of mappy's memory usage.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/2bbd711663540c5a060ea2fd82472623b346bd7a remora 0.1.2 -  fixes bonito/remora hanging https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/issues/216.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/6e91a9d641398e4dc8200dca1c5f950f554fd3c3 sensible minimum scaling factor - fixes https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/issues/209.

### Misc
 - Upgrade to the latest Mappy.
 - Python3.6 support dropped _(EOL)._

### Installation

The default version on PyTorch in PyPI supports Volta and below _(SM70)_ and can be installed like so - 

```
$ pip install ont-bonito
```

For newer GPUs _(Turing, Ampere)_ please use -

```
$ pip install -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html ont-bonito-cuda113
```

name: v0.5.0
body:
### Highlights
 
 - Modified basecalling via [Remora](https://github.com/nanoporetech/remora/).
 - Aligned/unaligned SAM/BAM/CRAM output support with read groups _([draft spec](https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/blob/master/documentation/SAM.md))_.
 - Fast/HAC/SUP models for R9.4.1 E8, R9.4.1 E8.1 and R10.4 E8.1.
 - Model performance for SUP & HAC models are now inline with Guppy.
 - Fully calibrated qstring/qscores for all models.
 - Automatic model downloading. 

### Modified Basecalling

Methylation/modified base calling can now be enabled with a single flag `--modified-bases`.

```bash
$ bonito basecaller dna_r9.4.1_e8_hac@v3.3 reads --modified-bases 5mC --ref ref.mmi | samtools sort -o out.bam -
$ samtools index out.bam
$ modbam2bed -a 0.2 -b 0.8 --cpg -r chr20 -m 5mC -e ref.fa out.bam > results_5mC.bed
```

### Models

All model identifiers include the model version, ambiguous unversioned models are no longer provided.

| Condition |  Fast               | High Accuracy | Super Accuracy | 
| --------- | ------------- |------------- |------------- |
| R9.4.1 E8    |  `dna_r9.4.1_e8_fast@v3.4` | `dna_r9.4.1_e8_hac@v3.3` | `dna_r9.4.1_e8_sup@v3.3` |
| R9.4.1 E8.1  | `dna_r9.4.1_e8.1_fast@v3.4` | `dna_r9.4.1_e8.1_hac@v3.3` | `dna_r9.4.1_e8.1_sup@v3.3` |
| R10.4  E8.1 | `dna_r10.4_e8.1_fast@v3.4` |  `dna_r10.4_e8.1_hac@v3.4` | `dna_r10.4_e8.1_sup@v3.4` |

Available models can be listed with ` bonito download --models --list`.

v3.4 models are newly released whereas v3.3 models have been available previously, however, all models have newly tuned configs. Fast models are now higher accuracy 128 wide models.

Models configs have been tuned for performance and the batch sizes have been selected to use approximately 11GB of GPU memory. If you have a GPU with less than this please reduce the batch size with `--batchsize` when base calling.

### Misc

 - CUDA 11.3 builds added.
 - Updated dependency highlights: `pytorch==1.10`, `mappy=2.23`. 
 - Duplex calling superseded by significantly higher performance inplmention in Guppy 6.0.
 - Basecaller default parameters can now be set in the model `config.toml` under the `[basecaller]` section 
 - Command line parameters will now override `config.toml` settings.
 - SAM tags included when output `.fastq` _(SAM/BAM/CRAM is recommended however)_.
 
**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/compare/v0.4.0...v0.5.0

name: v0.4.0
body:
## Duplex calling 

Bonito duplex calling for crf-ctc models. This method takes template & complement pairs to produce higher quality calls.

```
$ bonito duplex dna_r9.4.1 /data/reads --pairs pairs.txt --reference ref.mmi > basecalls.sam
```
 
The `pairs.csv` file is expected to contain pairs of read-ids per line *(separated by a single space)*.

Follow-on reads can also be automatically paired if an alignment summary file is provided instead of a `pairs.csv`.

```
$ bonito duplex dna_r9.4.1 /data/reads --summary alignment_summary.txt --reference ref.mmi > basecalls
```

The duplex caller replaces the older `bonito pair` interface and builds on the work from @jordisr and @ihh <sup>[1](https://genomebiology.biomedcentral.com/articles/10.1186/s13059-020-02255-1)</sup>.

> 1. Silvestre-Ryan, J., Holmes, I. Pair consensus decoding improves accuracy of neural network basecallers for nanopore sequencing. Genome Biol 22, 38 (2021). https://doi.org/10.1186/s13059-020-02255-1

name: v0.3.8
body: - 60ac4a7bf13a9dcb49d207ad455c651dc46ff347 add scipy to the requirements *(hotfix)*.

name: v0.3.7
body:
Improved R9.4.1 *`(dna_r9.4.1@v3.3)`* and R10.3 *`(dna_r10.3@v3.3)`*  models for existing chemistries. 

 - 9abea073b636c78a6e615a244ae1c5d5cd705ef7 CRF models move to using a single blank score.
 - 3def77d66c42c3038f800ff21376b196c2ae4590 non-uniform first chunk strategy instead of zero-padding.
 - 3342d1b8df0e306035558f75c65724047c0b4401 Ability to call the reverse complement sequence.
 - 651b9c14bbac7fb8a1b01db1610dde97eb4d2d76 bonito export for converting models to guppy.
 - 9ac04ddd2bc579606be06636ecc1dde40e7f9c06 upgrade to PyTorch 1.8.
 - 9739d6bad5b8de7ef656f54f5fcf53fd4b352b91 read trimming.
 - ae221ca6dbf31000b89930b83496bc306f1949d5 handle strings and bytes from h5py.
 - 6349f8dab63ed4eef7e7afd3b91136e32d5af9c8 batch summary write to avoid performance degradation with slower output locations *(i.e. NFS)*.

*Note: with the upgrade to PyTorch 1.8 this release drops support for Python 3.5.*

name: v0.3.6
body:
New R9.4.1 and R10.3 models for existing chemistries that improve on barcode classification, long deletions, and cleans up erroneous repeat runs to start calls with R10.3. 

The new models are downloaded when bonito `v0.3.6` is installed. To manually update `dna_r9.4.1` and `dna_r10.3` to point to the latest models run `bonito download --models --latest -f` or to download all models run `bonito download --models -f`. 

```bash
$ bonito download --models -f
[downloading models]
[downloaded dna_r9.4.1@v1.zip]                                                                      
[downloaded dna_r9.4.1@v2.zip]                                                                      
[downloaded dna_r9.4.1@v3.zip]                                                                      
[downloaded dna_r9.4.1@v3.1.zip]                                                                    
[downloaded dna_r9.4.1@v3.2.zip]                                                                    
[downloaded dna_r9.4.1.zip]                                                                         
[downloaded dna_r10.3_q20ea.zip]                                                                    
[downloaded dna_r10.3@v3.zip]                                                                       
[downloaded dna_r10.3@v3.2.zip]                                                                     
[downloaded dna_r10.3.zip]  
```

The new model versions are `dna_r9.4.1@v3.2` and `dna_r10.3@v3.2`.

name: v0.3.5
body:
- 06b10407746bc5267276ef4f97948fb4dfbb72ee added `dna_r10.3_q20ea` model.
 - 3615abcc2928e4a9add0786d1c3fbba92cebcf13 interupting basecalling with `ctrl+c` will now exit gracefully.
 - 82dc81d4ab2e02d2be071c66816ec8bf464b5a5e basecalling performance inpoved upto 35%  by overlapping DtoH memcopies with model inference [@sirelkhatim @EpiSlim]
 - 7796927ef60eebf026851c57f8feb35301e44378 fix growing memory usage when basecalling.
 - a11be1c9bf35aa8b5e7aacef49c3eb4ee887e4ca add `--max-reads` arguments to basecaller.
 - b1713d44b4f348d8821e8991ecda2fbb55a1baf1 use a fixed validation directory when training is present.
 - 6ceed73ea4c5fb3ab706e5c395c951b82fba7d53 apply optional `indices.npy` when loading training data.
 - e2cd5cf580a55df542186a22018fe0c0696facb2 remove preshuffle when loading training data.
 - 1ec1d2bd63fcbb081487f4e06884c4dc6247bba2 ability to finetune a pretrained model on new data
    - `bonito training --epochs 1 --lr 5e-4 --pretrained dna_r9.4.1 --directory new-training-data fine-tuned-model`

name: v0.3.2
body:
- https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/a7be8a0dc4602beced5696bc62b28a2fd3bf3b7f R10.3 model. 
- https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/c187c8482ee43ef3d3108d68024d65e2ba86c443 uncap the number of training examples by default.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/4ec933a4cf4212bda326f9ab107134c9ea87f229 stop storing/loading the optimizer state.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/b39e191c183fff5b795b4aebd7b5439a8f9507f0 record a more fine-grained loss log.

name: v0.3.1
body:
- https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/282bf1913cf7f51e0792919cf57d7d58ebb7d0a0 new fine-tuned `@v3.1` model. 
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/5810be86bfd5715a01838b3a73fc6e03338b9a30 medaka model + zymo results.
- https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/2c51ec5a68f77be15c4f915997f7de575fcb1a6d recursive directory searching.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/a39bf52708d4579370bd1e97adfed0d5385c1170 produce a valid fastq file with CRF models *(uses a default qstring value)*.
 - https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/c1ae23b3ddbe269965d49869615f41247a71e003 fix the `--save-ctc` pipeline for `@v2` models.

name: v0.3.0
body:
- Higher accuracy Bonito CRF models *(+ a lot faster to train)*.
 - Multiproc Fast5 producer for faster ingest.
 - Include MD tags when writing SAM.
 - Numerous bugfixes and improvements.

*Note: bonito now indirectly depends on CUDA 10.2*

name: v0.2.3
body:
### Changes

 - 0b7ad17a3e72786e978260e966de2ae0de8a59c9 add `--save-ctc` to `bonito basecaller` to save calls in the training format.
 - 82907bd4d13912fe8043717dae37136fbb9131de automatically detect if FP16 is supported and use by default if so.
 - 9746bcca59110eaaeaa2aa55f43e43366ffeee04 set the default number of training epochs to 20.

name: v0.2.2
body:
### Changes

 - 79811cd761d8c63d2179b64b06a8f91d19f68a84 output SAM when provided a reference.
 - 033d9043c4b5a83e7ed21cde9796d647933c49d6 alignment summary `.tsv`.
 - 9e35b81377b12550d1d0554f71f7ad2c5c07fdd9 grab bag of training improvements

name: v0.2.1
body:
### Changes
 
 - c89cc04a839707ed09c4ec12f79daaedcabc9a48 summary tsv output. 
 - dd25dbbc4f0050217c925a3368502ce8f9f85e2 better calibrate qscores.
 - 7a90664e0c64c6d9b1c420becc85242d90dcc186 simpler chunking for training data + validation split on read level.

name: v0.2.0
body:
### Changes 

 - 5a12b004bc32afc6260edab1adb5988a5d9cf00a new model configuration that is both more accurate and converges faster.
 - f330dba4f17dfd438daec85b62efc147ca05e7a7 optional single read chunking and stitching for higher performance inference.
 - aac9b9e78291fe50a65046e3be18f9fd0ed8009c initial support for faster custom CUDA runtime.
 - f440ca230cdf345d41b876515f261797b056f3c6 initial pair decoding workflow.

name: v0.1.5
body:
### Changes

eab453debf169674970315fcf4901aec94ac898d switch to more robust read normalising approach.

name: v0.1.4
body:
### Changes

bfd972d4cfc75bda7f9522d6f1e6c5bebdc2c7c2 fastq output support.

### Usage

```bash
$ bonito basecaller --fastq dna_r9.4.1 /data/reads > basecalls.fastq
``` 

*Note: when outputting to fastq a viterbi decoder is used instead of a beam search which impacts accuracy slightly.*

name: v0.1.2
body:
### Changes
 
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/52ccf0407c3b080f1fd7942a5c98ec7910477b95  hold out a set of chunks for model evaluation.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/36deabc26cb36c41536c62bac80709b3e0147865 `bonito download` for retrieving pretrained models and training assets.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/db30bdcc60f46c7ef549a431a7b6c50c9817af16 `bonito convert` for chunking up `hdf5` training files.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/fe4dfd9d27ba6bacfcc2f55e8edf12b28a29fcd6 multi-gpu training support.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/43327e32a5eb4d26c25a4110e4cfc346a4eed46b resume training.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/6b38f648da9aceca9609da3d7a20aca3285a3311 don't write empty fasta records.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/3439bb6516c99e8510e49ddad30533c9dbd65de2 store the parameters used to chunk the training data.
https://github.com/nanoporetech/bonito/commit/45679381b08828561c357afcf564b35aecc8996a debian packaging.
- Increased basecalling performance.
